description.raw:
This pull request implements the generation of MATLAB mex files on Windows.

The whole thing is quite a hack, since we are using cmake variables to compose a Windows command to be run directly in the command line, which turns into problems when cmake variable are more than just a string.

There are some other approaches out there, trying not to use the mex command (is not really more than some special configurations/flags for the compiler) but call the compiler directly using compiler + mex flags. I prefer to use the direct call to the mex script.

[This is the testing run on jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/haptix_comm-any-devel-windows7-amd64/51/) which generates the [.mex files](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/haptix_comm-any-devel-windows7-amd64/ws/workspace/haptix-comm/build/matlab/).
description.html:
This pull request implements the generation of MATLAB mex files on Windows.

The whole thing is quite a hack, since we are using cmake variables to compose a Windows command to be run directly in the command line, which turns into problems when cmake variable are more than just a string.

There are some other approaches out there, trying not to use the mex command (is not really more than some special configurations/flags for the compiler) but call the compiler directly using compiler + mex flags. I prefer to use the direct call to the mex script.

This is the testing run on jenkins which generates the .mex files.

title.raw: Auto MEX files generation using MATLAB
